articles.title: US soldier's widow says Trump forgot her husband's name in condolence call
articles.description: The pregnant widow of a fallen US soldier contradicts Donald Trump's account of his phone call about her husband's death

articles.author: CATHERINE LUCEY
articles.title: Soldier's widow angry Trump didn't know her husband's name
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The widow of a fallen soldier reproached President Donald Trump Monday over his condolence call last week, saying she was angered by his tone and that he couldn't remember her husband's name. Trump quickly responded on Twitter that he'd been "very respectful" and spoke the name "without hesitation." Monday's harsh exchange was the latest in an ongoing dispute over how Trump responded to the deaths of four service members in the African nation of Niger.

articles.title: Soldier's widow: Trump forgot my husband's name - CNN Video
articles.description: The widow of a soldier killed in Niger appears on "Good Morning America" and says US President Trump "couldn't even remember his name."

articles.author: Amanda Holpuch
articles.title: Donald Trump in row with soldier's widow over condolence call
articles.description: President rejects claim he couldn’t remember Sgt La David Johnson’s name as Myeshia Johnson says call left her ‘very upset and hurt; it made me cry even worse’

articles.author: Willa Frej
articles.title: Widow Of U.S. Soldier Killed In Niger: Trump's Call 'Made Me Cry Even Worse'
articles.description: Myeshia Johnson confirmed the president told her that her husband “knew what he signed up for.”

articles.author: Alexandra Wilts
articles.title: A soldier's widow said Trump forgot her husband's name. Trump says it's not true
articles.description: Donald Trump has claimed he spoke the name of Sgt. La David Johnson “from the beginning” of a conversation with the serviceman's widow – contradicting the wife's account of the President's condolence call after her husband was killed during an ambush in Niger.

articles.author: Harriet Sinclair
articles.title: Tom Hanks says Trump's comment to soldier's widow was "one of the biggest cock-ups"
articles.description: The actor added his voice to those criticizing the president's comment.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Widow of slain U.S. soldier says Trump call 'made me cry even worse'
articles.description: The widow of a U.S. Army sergeant killed in Niger this month said on Monday that President Donald Trump "made me cry even worse" in a condolence telephone call when he said that her husband "knew what he signed up for."

articles.title: Donald Trump hits back after grieving widow says president 'could not remember my husband's name'
articles.description: Donald Trump has hit back at the pregnant widow of an American soldier killed in Niger, denying that he made her cry during a condolence call by forgetting her dead husband’s name.

articles.title: Soldier's widow still 'very angry' about Trump call last week, says Rep. Wilson's statement '100% correct'
articles.description: The widow of Army Sgt. La David Johnson said Monday that she is upset because the president struggled with her husband's name.

articles.author: Kristine Phillips, J. Freedom du Lac, Kristine Phillips, J. Freedom du Lac
articles.title: Gold Star widow Myeshia Johnson has ‘nothing to say’ to Trump after controversial condolence call
articles.description: Trump disputed her account, characterizing his conversation with Sgt. La David Johnson's widow as “very respectful.”

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Soldier's widow: Trump 'made me cry'
articles.description: She says President Trump could not remember her husband's name when he phoned to offer condolences.

articles.author: Maegan Vazquez, CNN
articles.title: Trump disputes military widow's account of condolence call
articles.description: President Donald Trump on Monday disputed a widow's account of a condolence call he made to her following the death of her husband in Niger earlier this month.

articles.title: Nuclear threat from North Korea 'unprecedented, critical and imminent'
articles.description: Japan's Defence Minister says the threat from North Korea's nuclear programme is at a critical and imminent level.

articles.author: Andrew Buncombe
articles.title: North Korea's nuclear threat is now at a 'critical and imminent level', says Japan
articles.description: The threat from North Korea’s developing nuclear and conventional weapons programme has reached a “critical and imminent level”

articles.author: Will Worley
articles.title: North Korea just sent an 'unprecedented' open letter to the West
articles.description: North Korea has sent an unprecedented open letter to the West, urging “sharp vigilance” against the “heinous and reckless” administration of Donald Trump.  It also announces the emergence of North Korea as a “fully fledged nuclear power". It is believed the letter, written by the Foreign Affairs Committee, was sent to a number of Western countries covertly.

articles.author: Phil Stewart
articles.title: North Korea threat is 'critical, imminent,' Japan tells U.S., South Korea
articles.description: The threat from North Korea has grown to a "critical and imminent level" and the United States, Japan and South Korea must address the matter, Japanese Defense Minister Itsunori Onodera told his U.S. and South Korean counterparts in talks on Monday.

articles.title: Prominent Russian journalist stabbed at news radio station
articles.description: The deputy editor-in-chief for Russia's leading news radio station is stabbed by an unknown attacker, the company says.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Russian radio presenter stabbed in neck
articles.description: Moscow police arrest a man who stabbed and seriously wounded a top Russian radio journalist.

articles.author: Shaun Walker
articles.title: Russian radio journalist stabbed in neck at her Moscow office
articles.description: Tatyana Felgenhauer, deputy editor of Ekho Moskvy radio station, in serious but not critical condition after attack

articles.author: PETER PRENGAMAN, SARAH DiLORENZO and DANIEL TRIELLI
articles.title: Millions return to poverty in Brazil, eroding 'boom' decade
articles.description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — When Leticia Miranda had a job selling newspapers on the streets, she earned about $160 a month, just enough to pay for a tiny apartment she shared with her 8-year-old son in a poor neighborhood of Rio de Janeiro. When she lost her job about six months ago amid Brazil's worst economic crisis in decades, Miranda had no choice but to move to an abandoned building where several hundred people were already living. All of her possessions — a bed, a fridge, a stove and some clothes — have been jammed into a small room that like all the others in the building has windows with no glass. Residents bathe in large garbage cans filled with water and do their best to live with the stench of mountains of trash and rummaging pigs in the center of the building.

articles.author: PETER PRENGAMAN, SARAH DiLORENZO and DANIEL TRIELLI
articles.title: Millions return to poverty in Brazil, eroding 'boom' decade
articles.description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — When Leticia Miranda had a job selling newspapers on the streets, she earned about $160 a month, just enough to pay for a tiny apartment she shared with her 8-year-old son in a poor neighborhood of Rio de Janeiro. When she lost her job about six months ago amid Brazil's worst economic crisis in decades, Miranda had no choice but to move to an abandoned building where several hundred people were already living. All of her possessions — a bed, a fridge, a stove and some clothes — have been jammed into a small room that like all the others in the building has windows with no glass. Residents bathe in large garbage cans filled with water and do their best to live with the stench of mountains of trash and rummaging pigs in the center of the building.

articles.author: JILL COLVIN and ALAN FRAM
articles.title: Trump tweets that 401(k) tax incentives 'safe' in tax plan
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Donald Trump promised Monday there will be "no change" to tax incentives for the popular 401(k) retirement programs. "This has always been a great and popular middle class tax break that works, and it stays!" Trump tweeted. The president appeared to be responding to a recent report in The New York Times that Republican lawmakers were considering limiting the amount workers could save in 401(k) retirement accounts. He tweeted: "There will be NO change to your 401(k)."

articles.title: Trump: There will be no changes to 401(k) retirement plans
articles.description: The president seems to be removing a bargaining chip from congressional negotiations over tax reform.

articles.author: Philip Rucker, Philip Rucker
articles.title: Trump pledges ‘NO change to your 401(k)’ in his tax cut plan
articles.description: Several news organizations reported last week that congressional Republicans were considering a cap on contributions to 401(k) programs as part of a broad overhaul of the tax code.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Trump dismisses 401(k) changes, additional bracket for tax plan
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday dismissed the possibility of limiting popular 401(k) retirement savings plans to help pay for Republicans' sweeping tax plan and expressed doubts about adding another top bracket targeting high earners.

articles.author: ROBERT BURNS
articles.title: Japanese defense minister sounds alarm on North Korea
articles.description: CLARK, Philippines (AP) — Japan's defense minister asserted Monday that North Korea's nuclear and ballistic missile capabilities have grown to an "unprecedented, critical and imminent" level, requiring "different responses" to the threat. The minister, Itsunori Odonera, said that this rising threat compels his country to endorse the U.S. view that "all options" must be considered, which President Donald Trump says includes possible military action. Japan was alarmed by North Korea twice launching missiles over Japanese territory, in August and in September.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Japan PM promises to tackle North Korea
articles.description: Shinzo Abe pledges strong "counter-measures" against Pyongyang after a decisive election win.

articles.author: JONATHAN DREW
articles.title: Military judge in Bergdahl case worries about Trump impact
articles.description: FORT BRAGG, N.C. (AP) — The judge deciding Army Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl's punishment said Monday he is concerned that President Donald Trump's comments about the case could impact the public's perception of the military justice system. Sentencing for Bergdahl on charges of desertion and misbehavior before the enemy was set to begin Monday, but the judge, Army Col. Jeffery R. Nance, instead heard arguments about a last-minute motion by defense attorneys that recent comments by Trump are preventing Bergdahl from getting a fair sentence. Bergdahl faces life in prison on charges that he endangered comrades by walking off his post in Afghanistan in 2009.

articles.author: Greg Lacour
articles.title: Judge to decide Trump's sway in U.S. Army deserter Bergdahl's case
articles.description: A military judge will weigh whether President Donald Trump's critical statements about U.S. Army Sergeant Bowe Bergdahl have hurt the soldier's chances of getting fair treatment in the desertion case that could send him to prison for life.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: McCain hits Trump on Vietnam draft dodge
articles.description: The Republican noted Mr Trump's medical excuse while criticising how the wealthy avoided the war.

articles.author: Nick Visser
articles.title: John McCain Slams Wealthy Draft Dodgers In Apparent Swipe At Trump
articles.description: "If we're going to ask every American to serve, every American should serve.”

articles.author: Catherine E. Shoichet, Dan Simon and Tal Kopan, CNN
articles.title: Opening statements to begin in case that sparked sanctuary cities debate
articles.description: Kate Steinle's killing became a rallying cry for President Trump and others who want to crack down on illegal immigration. Now her alleged killer will face a jury.

articles.author: Tal Kopan, CNN
articles.title: What are sanctuary cities, and can they be defunded?
articles.description: President Donald Trump signed an executive order Wednesday designed to crack down on so-called sanctuary cities -- setting up a showdown with immigration advocates.

articles.author: Jack de Menezes
articles.title: Ronald Koeman has been sacked by Everton
articles.description: Ronald Koeman has been sacked by Everton following Sunday's 5-2 defeat by Arsenal, the club has confirmed.

articles.author: Simon Rice
articles.title: Everton sack Ronald Koeman following 5-2 defeat to Arsenal
articles.description: He's gone!

articles.title: Everton sack Ronald Koeman after defeat to Arsenal, with Sean Dyche earmarked as possible replacement
articles.description: Everton have sacked Ronald Koeman after the club’s disastrous start to the season – with Sean Dyche emerging as a potential target to replace him.

articles.author: Henry Vaughn
articles.title: Police hunt conman 'who defrauded divorcee of £850,000'
articles.description: Police hunting one of Britain’s most wanted fugitives have released details of his wife and two daughters in the hope they could provide the key to his capture. Mark Acklom, 44, who is alleged to have fleeced a divorcee out of £850,000 in life savings in a romance scam, was last spotted in Geneva, Switzerland, on 10 May. Avon and Somerset Police believe he is with his wife, Maria Yolanda Ros Rodriguez, 47, and their two daughters, aged six and eight.

articles.author: Henry Vaughan, Rachel Bishop
articles.title: Cops concern for daughters of UK fugitive who 'stole £850,000 from divorcee'
articles.description: Officers are concerned for the wellbeing of the girls, aged six and eight, after dad Mark George Acklom, 44, is believed to have taken them out of their school in Spain

articles.author: Jon Stone
articles.title: EU says May-Juncker dinner account was leaked by 'some people' to undermine EU in Brexit talks
articles.description: The European Commission has accused “some people” of leaking an account of Theresa May’s dinner with president Jean-Claude Juncker to undermine the EU’s position on Brexit talks.

articles.title: Then and now: How leaked account of Brexit dinner with Jean-Claude Juncker undermined Theresa May yet again
articles.description: Last week's EU summit was hailed as a breakthrough moment for Theresa May as European leaders responded in a largely positively manner to her call to work together on Brexit.

articles.title: Jean-Claude Juncker claims 'nothing is true' in leaked Brexit dinner report as Theresa May faces grilling by MPs
articles.description: Jean Claude-Juncker has insisted that “nothing is true” in a leaked report of a private Brexit dinner with Theresa May which described the Prime Minister as “tormented” and “despondent”.

articles.author: Christopher Bucktin
articles.title: North Korea boasts of “fully fledged nuclear power" in open letter to Trump
articles.description: The “unprecedented” document also urged for “sharp vigilance” against the “heinous and reckless” administration of the US President

articles.author: Graham Lanktree
articles.title: Nuclear bombers poised to return to 24-hour alert as Trump's rhetoric with North Korea increases
articles.description: Trump has said military options are on the table if Pyongyang doesn't end its nuclear weapons program.

articles.author: Kate Sheridan
articles.title: Here's how Trump is going to make your seasonal depression worse this winter
articles.description: Stressors like Trump's threat to obliterate North Korea could contribute to the seasonal blues.

articles.author: Steve Holland and Matt Spetalnick
articles.title: Trump to press China on North Korea, trade on Beijing visit
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump will urge Chinese President Xi Jinping to fully implement U.N. Security Council resolutions against North Korea and take other steps to pressure Pyongyang when he travels to China next month, a senior White House official said on Monday.

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: US mulls sanctions on Myanmar over Rohingya crisis
articles.description: Washington to withdraw military assistance to Myanmar forces as it considers measures against human rights abuses.

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: U.S. Considers Punishing Myanmar With Sanctions Over Treatment Of Rohingya Muslims
articles.description: “We are exploring accountability mechanisms available under U.S. law, including Global Magnitsky targeted sanctions.”

articles.author: GERRY SHIH
articles.title: Xi accrues power, worrying critics and delighting supporters
articles.description: BEIJING (AP) — The model lunar rover didn't much impress the retiree in a cotton Mao jacket visiting an exhibition of Chinese achievements under President Xi Jinping. Nor did the displays charting China's climate change progress or other technological advancements. Instead, it was an exhibit showing how Xi has locked up thousands of corrupt officials that drew his approval. "We finally have a leader who is doing something right," said the retiree, a 72-year-old former wastewater worker who would give only his surname, Lu, as he gazed at pictures of handcuffed Communist Party cadres. "He's strong. He's not afraid of anything, or anyone."

articles.author: GERRY SHIH
articles.title: Xi accrues power, worrying critics and delighting supporters
articles.description: BEIJING (AP) — The model lunar rover didn't much impress the retiree in a cotton Mao jacket visiting an exhibition of Chinese achievements under President Xi Jinping. Nor did the displays charting China's climate change progress or other technological advancements. Instead, it was an exhibit showing how Xi has locked up thousands of corrupt officials that drew his approval. "He's strong. He's not afraid of anything, or anyone."

articles.author: ERICA WERNER
articles.title: Trump plans lunch with GOP senators as focus turns to taxes
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Donald Trump is planning lunch with GOP senators after sparring with several of them, as congressional Republicans turn to overhauling the tax code. It will be Trump's first appearance as president at Senate Republicans' regular Tuesday policy lunch at the Capitol. The gathering has the potential for awkward moments, because it follows spats between Trump and GOP senators such as John McCain of Arizona and Bob Corker of Tennessee, as well as Majority Leader Mitch McConnell of Kentucky.

articles.author: Stephen Collinson, CNN
articles.title: Trump set to woo GOP senators over taxes
articles.description: President Donald Trump and Capitol Hill Republicans are giving it another whirl -- because they've got no other choice.

articles.author: EILEEN NG and ERIC TALMADGE
articles.title: Women on trial visit scene of attack on North Korean scion
articles.description: SEPANG, Malaysia (AP) — The two women accused of killing the half brother of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un were taken back to the scene of the crime on Tuesday as their murder trial moved from the courtroom to the Malaysian airport for a three-hour inspection tour under heavy police guard. The judge, prosecutors, defense lawyers and representatives of the women's home countries were escorted inside the Kuala Lumpur airport by heavily armed police on a tour meant to give the court a better perspective of events as they unfolded.

articles.title: North Korea: women accused of killing Kim Jong-nam revisit scene of crime
articles.description: Suspects Siti Aisyah and Doan Thi Huong take part in reconstruction at Malaysia’s Kuala Lumpur airport, watched by judge and lawyers

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Xi 'most powerful leader since Mao'
articles.description: China's president is now on a level where challenging him means threatening Communist Party rule.

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.title: Xi Jinping becomes most powerful leader since Mao with China's change to constitution
articles.description: Rare accolade puts Xi’s Thought on Socialism with Chinese Characteristics into Communist charter and sets him on course for indefinite spell in power

articles.author: Staff and agencies
articles.title: China just made its President the most powerful leader since Mao
articles.description: China's ruling Communist Party has amended its constitution to add President Xi Jinping's name and ideology in an extension of his formidable political sway. Mr Xi's concept of “socialism with Chinese characteristics for a new era” was added to the party constitution at the close of a twice-a-decade major congress.

articles.title: Xi Jinping's ideology enshrined to China's Communist Party constitution
articles.description: In a sign of Xi Jinping’s greater clout, his name was attached to his theory, putting him on par with Deng and communist China’s founder, Mao Zedong.

articles.title: Dem. Senator: I may support Trump's tax plan - CNN Video
articles.description: Sen. Sherrod Brown (D-OH) says he may support President Trump's tax reform package if it includes tax breaks for middle class families and corporations who don't outsource jobs.

articles.title: Ex-mayor rips Trump's call to Gold Star widow - CNN Video
articles.description: Michael Nutter, the former mayor of Philadelphia, criticizes President Donald Trump's phone call to the grieving widow of a US soldier killed during an ambush in Niger.

articles.author: Andrew Sparrow
articles.title: European council president suggests Brexit could be halted - Politics live
articles.description: Rolling coverage of the day’s political developments as they happen

articles.author: Jon Stone
articles.title: The president of the European Council just said Brexit can still be stopped
articles.description: The president of the European Council has suggested the UK could still decide to reverse Brexit. Donald Tusk said negotiations could end in "no Brexit" if the British government wanted to. "Ahead of us is still the toughest stress test. If we fail it, the negotiations will end in our defeat," he said in a speech at the European Parliament in Strasbourg. "We must keep our unity regardless of the direction of the talks. The EU will be able to rise to every scenario as long as we are not divided."

articles.author: Jonathan Chait@jonathanchait
articles.title: Trump Is Still Treating the Federal Government Like He Owns It
articles.description: The president continues to abuse his power, and we’ve stopped paying attention.

articles.title: All the president's men and women: Trump-like leaders proliferate
articles.description: A look at the international Trump effect.

articles.author: John Koblin
articles.title: Latest Bill O’Reilly Case Is ‘Jaw-Dropping,’ Megyn Kelly Says
articles.description: Needing a ratings boost, the host of “Megyn Kelly Today” targets what she calls a culture of sexual harassment at her former employer.

articles.author: Paul Farhi, Paul Farhi
articles.title: Megyn Kelly blasts Bill O’Reilly on her NBC morning show
articles.description: The former Fox News star went after her old network with a blistering monologue.
